question: What is the function of lysozyme?
ideal_answer: Lysozymes are an ancient group of antimicrobial enzymes of the innate immune system. Lysozyme activity is a marker of Paneth cell function.

snippets.text: Lysozyme activity (a marker of Paneth cell function)
Lysozymes are an ancient group of antimicrobial enzymes of the innate immune system.
It displays chitinase and lysozyme activity, which could be important for the defense against pathogenic fungi, insects and bacteria.
